product.title: ASUS Vivobook S 14 OLED Slim Laptop, AMD Ryzen AI 9 365(10 Cores), 24GB, 512GB SSD, Customizable RGB Keyboard, Neutral Black, M5406WA-DS76

protection_plans.title: Complete Protect: One plan covers all eligible past and future purchases (Renews Monthly Until Cancelled)

product.categories_flat: Electronics > Computers & Accessories > Computers & Tablets > Laptops > Traditional Laptops
product.description: The ASUS Vivobook S 14 transforms your laptop experience with cutting-edge technology and a sleek minimalist design. Powered by the AMD Ryzen 9 processor, it delivers top-notch performance with up to 45+ TOPS NPU, enhancing your productivity to the next level and unlocking brand new AI experiences. The dedicated Copilot key provides instant one-touch access to AI capabilities. With a slim profile, weighing 2.87 lbs, and up to a 75 Wh battery life, it’s designed for on-the-go convenience. The laptop boasts a stunning up to 3K ASUS Lumina OLED display, an ergonomic keyboard with RGB backlighting, an extra-large touchpad, and an ASUS AiSense camera. It’s your perfect companion for modern life.

videos.title: Vivobook INTEL CELERON N4500 PROCESSOR Review

videos_additional.title: Vivobook INTEL CELERON N4500 PROCESSOR Review

feature_bullets: UNLEASH EFFORTLESS PERFORMANCE — Power through any task with Windows 11 Home, a blazing-fast AMD Ryzen 9 processor with a 45+ TOPS NPU,24GB of LPDDR5X RAM, and a spacious 512GB SSD

STUNNING, SMOOTH VISUALS — 14” 3K (2880 x 1800) 120Hz ASUS Lumina OLED display delivers extremely smooth and vivid visuals, with a taller 16:10 aspect ratio that allows you to see more. The OLED display offers an ultrafast 0.2ms response time, up to 600nits peak HDR brightness, and 100% DCI-P3 color gamut
SO SLIM, SO LIGHT — Incredibly portable at just 0.63” thin, and weighs only 2.87 lbs
CUSTOMIZABLE RGB KEYBOARD — With a single-zone RGB backlit keyboard, you can personalize backlight colors, modes, and brightness levels, while enjoying the ergonomic typing experience

EXTENSIVE CONNECTIVITY — 2x USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A, 1x USB 4.0 Gen 3 Type-C support display / power delivery 1x USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-C support display / power delivery, Micro SD card reader, 1x HDMI 2.1 TMDS, 1x 3.5mm Combo Audio Jack

CUSTOMIZABLE RGB KEYBOARD — With a single-zone RGB backlit keyboard, you can personalize backlight colors, modes, and brightness levels, while enjoying the ergonomic typing experience. SO SLIM, SO LIGHT — Incredibly portable at just 0.63” thin, and weighs only 2.87 lbs. The OLED display offers an ultrafast 0.2ms response time, up to 600nits peak HDR brightness, and 100% DCI-P3 color gamut. UNLEASH EFFORTLESS PERFORMANCE — Power through any task with Windows 11 Home, a blazing-fast AMD Ryzen 9 processor with a 45+ TOPS NPU,24GB of LPDDR5X RAM, and a spacious 512GB SSD.

top_reviews.title: great laptop
top_reviews.body: The laptop has a great display, it’s very lightweight for the performance, the intergrated gpu is way better than expected. I have installed linux on it though and every distro crashes randomly approx. once a day. If you want to install linux, I recommend waiting a few months for newer drivers. When trying to install windows, it requires some drivers, but no driver from the ASUS website works. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
The laptop has a great display, it’s very lightweight for the performance, the intergrated gpu is way better than expected.
I have installed linux on it though and every distro crashes randomly approx. once a day.
If you want to install linux, I recommend waiting a few months for newer drivers.
When trying to install windows, it requires some drivers, but no driver from the ASUS website works.
Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2024

top_reviews.title: Good allrounder
top_reviews.body: Laptop perfomrs good , battery last about 10 hours on youtube and and office work , if you do some serius stufff then you will get closer to 6. enormus diference of performance when plugged in , also a 20% performance increase when over a laptop ventilation base. measured in cinebench R23 14.534 and speeds of 2.3mhz vs 16.308, and speed tops at 3.3. advertised speeds are single core and for short durations. screen is really awesome super nice , good colors and more than you need brightness over all it performs as espected. a couple of defects, Track pad not good at all finger get kind of sticky on it , not a good surface to slide fingers , any whay I always use a external mouse. finger print magnet , it gets dirty really quickly . there is a bit of a gap where you open the lid. Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2024

top_reviews.title: Incredible Found
top_reviews.body: I've barely had this laptop two months, and it began crashing with a bsod several times a day. Now it doesn't even boot. Unsure if this is ASUS' problem or issues with the new AMD platform, but either way it sucks Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
I've barely had this laptop two months, and it began crashing with a bsod several times a day. Now it doesn't even boot. Unsure if this is ASUS' problem or issues with the new AMD platform, but either way it sucks

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2025

top_reviews.title: WELL. . . .
top_reviews.body: Do not expect to be able to read the keys in low light as the backlit keyboard works just fine as long as one has a flashlight to shine on it. Other than that, it is working fine, screen colors are good if not better than that, it was packaged well and it seems to be working well. Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023

top_reviews.title: Nice in concept, but poor QA
top_reviews.body: The laptop offers a decently powerful APU for standard office tasks and light gaming, while maintaining good battery life. Chassis feels nice, and on the lighter-weight size.  Unfortunately the QA is poor, leading me to return the laptop. I'm getting intermittent screen flickers after just a few weeks of use. Worse yet, the keyboard will periodically fail to register keystrokes, making typing even basic sentences painful. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
The laptop offers a decently powerful APU for standard office tasks and light gaming, while maintaining good battery life. Chassis feels nice, and on the lighter-weight size.

Unfortunately the QA is poor, leading me to return the laptop. I'm getting intermittent screen flickers after just a few weeks of use. Worse yet, the keyboard will periodically fail to register keystrokes, making typing even basic sentences painful.
Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2024

top_reviews.title: Good performance, questionable build quality.
top_reviews.body: The hinges and bezels near them creaked slightly when I lifted the lid. The right side of the touchpad was wobbly and would sink a bit if I rested my finger on it without actually pressing. There were also HDR issues, such as flickering. The keyboard felt nice, but the advertised wallpaper and keyboard RGB sync option was missing in the latest Windows 11 Pro version. I encountered problems with the USB A ports when trying to connect my Samsung T7 SSD. On the positive side, the colors on the OLED screen looked amazing, and typing felt smooth. Overall performance was great, though it’s not a gaming machine. It’s ideal for work, media consumption, and similar tasks. Batter was also okay, but nothing mindblowing. Just be mindful of brightness levels and avoid leaving static images on the screen for extended periods in order to avoid OLED burn in.  P.S. I had to pay $205 USD to return it to Amazon and even though they promised to refund the return shipping costs to me in full due to it being a faulty device, they refunded less than promised, and that was after at least 15 conversations with different agents and hours spent explaining the issue over and over again. The last agent said he'd allow a refund of $150 USD as a sign of Amazon's good will, as if they hadn't promised to give me all of my money back. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
The hinges and bezels near them creaked slightly when I lifted the lid. The right side of the touchpad was wobbly and would sink a bit if I rested my finger on it without actually pressing. There were also HDR issues, such as flickering. The keyboard felt nice, but the advertised wallpaper and keyboard RGB sync option was missing in the latest Windows 11 Pro version. I encountered problems with the USB A ports when trying to connect my Samsung T7 SSD. On the positive side, the colors on the OLED screen looked amazing, and typing felt smooth. Overall performance was great, though it’s not a gaming machine. It’s ideal for work, media consumption, and similar tasks. Batter was also okay, but nothing mindblowing. Just be mindful of brightness levels and avoid leaving static images on the screen for extended periods in order to avoid OLED burn in.

P.S. I had to pay $205 USD to return it to Amazon and even though they promised to refund the return shipping costs to me in full due to it being a faulty device, they refunded less than promised, and that was after at least 15 conversations with different agents and hours spent explaining the issue over and over again. The last agent said he'd allow a refund of $150 USD as a sign of Amazon's good will, as if they hadn't promised to give me all of my money back.
